items.title: Roma Lister, Aradia, and the Speculative Origins of a Witchcraft Revival
items.excerpt: In 1899, Charles Godfrey Leland published Aradia, “the gospel of the witches”, containing a goddess-orientated creation and saviour narrative, purported to descend from an ancient, hermetic tradition of witchcraft in Italy. A. D. Manns explores this text via an enchanting conjec…

items.title: Modern Babylon: Ziggurat Skyscrapers and Hugh Ferriss’ Retrofuturism
